page.title: 03BERKELEY PILL
page.content: Running through the middle of this area is a stream, known locally as the {Pill.}Until the late 1960's the Pill was tidal, when a{dam}was built close to where the Pill enters the{River {Severn.}Before the dam was built the local farmers had to build up the banks with earth mounds. There are places though where the banks slope gently down to the water so that cattle can drink from the Pill safely. The dam was built with a{non-return {valve}so that water could flow from the Pill to the river and not from the river up the Pill at high tides, so {preventing flooding. Situated on the Pill is an old{flour {mill}which used to be powered by pill water, but now uses electrical power. The Pill which is popular for{fishing passes close to{Berkeley Power Station before entering the River Severn.
